text: Wladimir Klitschko stopped Tony Thompson in the sixth round to retain his WBA, IBF and WBO heavyweight title belts on Saturday. Klitschko put Thompson on the canvas with a big right hand near the end of the fifth round at Stade de Suisse, and the 40 - year - old American never recovered. The Ukrainian champion dropped Thompson again in the sixth, and referee Sam Williams gave the challenger a standing count before stopping the fight. Klitschko finished the fight five rounds sooner than when knocking out Thompson in the 11th of their first title fight in 2008. Thompson, who was the mandatory challenger nominated by the IBF, fell to 36 - 3 (24 KO).
title: Wladimir Klitschko retains titles stopping Thompson in six rounds.
